1.text: Remove your shoelaces and put shoe trees or newspaper inside your sneakers.

2.text: Fill a bowl with 2–3 cups (470–710 mL) of sneaker cleaner or soapy water.

3.text: Soak your shoelaces in the cleaning solution while you work.

4.text: Dip a soft-bristled brush in the cleaning solution and scrub your shoes.

5.text: Step up to a hard-bristled brush if you still see dirt on the shoes.

6.text: Clean any tougher scuff marks with a microfiber towel.

7.text: Wipe the soap off with a wet towel and let your sneakers air dry.

8.text: Put your sneakers in a laundry bag along with your shoelaces.

9.text: Set the machine to a delicate cycle and wash your shoes with old white clothing.

10.text: Dry your sneakers by leaving them in a well-ventilated area for 24 hours.

11.text: Remove tough stains using white, non-gel toothpaste and water.

12.text: Deodorize your insoles by letting them air out with baking soda.

13.text: Remove scuff marks efficiently with a Magic Eraser and water.

14.text: Soak your laces in bleach and detergent to dye them white again.

15.text: Use lighter fluid to remove paint or gum from the rubber sole.
